doc.after: Romania's first national airline was founded in 1920 under the name CFRNA - (French-Romanian Company for Air Navigation). The airline used French-built Potez 15 aircraft for its passenger/mail service between Paris and Bucharest via several cities in Central Europe. In 1925, the city of GalaÅ£i became the first destination in Romania served by regular flights followed, from 24 June 1926, by an extended service to IaÅi and ChiÅinÄu. Ten de Havilland DH.9 and five Ansaldo A.300, in addition to the Potez aircraft, operated the service. In 1928 the airline changed its name to SNNA - Serviciul NaÅ£ional de NavigaÅ£ie AerianÄ (The National Air Navigation Service).
